articles.author: Sascha Pare
articles.title: Hot blob beneath Appalachians formed when Greenland split from North America — and it's heading to New York - Live Science
articles.description: A hot blob currently beneath the Appalachians may have peeled off from Greenland around 80 million years ago and moved to where it is today at a rate of 12 miles per million years, scientists have found.
articles.content:
A giant blob of abnormally hot rock beneath the Appalachian Mountains formed when Greenland separated from North America around 80 million years ago, new research suggests.
